data.title: RTL support based on ICU library.
data.body:
Hi
If the ICU [license](http://source.icu-project.org/repos/icu/icu/trunk/license.html) is acceptable, I think this PR can be considered as a reference implementation to find out the best approach to implement RTL support.
This feature is disable by default. Use rtl=yes in command line to enable it.
Text rendering and alignment implemented only for Button and Label but other controls(TextEdit, LineEdit, RichTextLabel) only have text rendering and not alignment.
I didn't removed unused files from icu source because maybe some of them can be use later.
Compilation tested for linux, windows(mingw) and android.

How to test:
- Compile editor and export templates with rtl=yes option.
- Add a RTL keyboard(language) to your device.
- Import a suitable font.Enable unicode when importing.
- Add font to Settings -> Editor Settings : Global/Font, Text Editor/Font.
- Restart Editor.
- Add some of controls mentioned above that support RTL.
- Change controls font to imported one.
- Finally, Test it!

This is based on mohaalak and masoudbh3 previous works. Thank you.

data.title: TileMap Tile Origin Center not respected by map_to_world()
data.body:
When calling map_to_world() in gdscript the returned coordinates are the top-left of the tile even if the tile origin is set to Center.  The expected behavior is that the center of the tile is returned.

Commit b12c2846ee03584c096a80cabe157560b74fa1bf includes a change to fix tile_map.cpp and it works perfect in runtime but the editor no longer displays properly.  tile_map_editor_plugin.cpp is very dense and trying to fix it to account for this change is intimidating so I wanted some feedback before attempting to tackle this issue.

data.title: Add StaticBody collision generation for all selected MeshInstance nodes
data.body:
Add collision generation for all selected MeshInstance nodes, using trimesh and convex shapes.

Cleaned MeshInstanceEditor source code, removed unnecessary includes and variables.

Closes #2225.

windows.  Need to ignore it.

data.title: Document Vector3 and Vector3Array.
data.body:
Also fixes the docs for `Vector2` and `Vector2Array`.

_(P.S. Waiting for Vector4 to come out, so I can document it :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: )_

data.title: Dictionary.hash() does not return equal values for equal data
Deprecate .pcz and use plain .zip instead
data.body:
Cloned from #2788:

@reduz:

> How about just deprecating the .pcz extension and use zip? We can make the exporter also write zips as an option to pck.

@punto-:

> Writing zips would be great, I've needed to create and debug my own pcks
> many times.
> 
> For the extension I don't mind either way, zips have many names nowadays,
> starting from the first Quake packages (that's actually where I found out
> about minizip, the library we use to read zips, the original Quake source),
> but also IPA, APK, etc. I suspect their reasoning is just to stop the
> operating system (and random users on some cases) from handling them, and
> to possibly associate the extension with their own program, which I'm not
> sure it's worth it for us.. We did have to rename the templates package for
> similar reasons a while ago..

data.title: Fix poorly formed documentation xml, text outside of tags
Remove unexpected GDScript aliases for built-in types
data.body:
These aliases are undocumented and rather unexpected.
Left in `Rect3` as alias for `AABB` since it is pretty sensible and uses capitalization.

data.title: Silence too verbose boot splash debug info
data.body:
This

```
BOOT SPLASH:  
BOOT SPLASH IS : 
```

on projects with absolutely no custom boot splash was starting to get on my nerves :p

data.title: Make all demo icons 8-bit/color RGB(A)
data.body:
Godot does not seem to like 8-bit colormaps.
Fixes #2874.

data.title: Project manager complains about the PNG format of some of the new demo icons
data.body:
When opening the project manager with the demos scanned, this message is shown several times:

```
ERROR: resize: Cannot resize in indexed, compressed or custom image formats.
   At: core/image.cpp:639.
```

After a quick check it seems to be due to the PNG format of some of the new icons for the demos. We have three types of colour formatting:

```
kinematic_col/icon.png:            PNG image data, 64 x 64, 8-bit/color RGBA, non-interlaced
light_mask/icon.png:               PNG image data, 64 x 64, 8-bit colormap, non-interlaced
lookat/icon.png:                   PNG image data, 64 x 64, 8-bit/color RGB, non-interlaced
```

The "colormap" one seems to be what Godot complains about.

data.title: Editor layouts menu
data.body:
With this feature you can save your current docks layout, and load it at any time and project.

All layouts are saved in the same file: _editor_layouts.cfg_ (same directory as _editor_settings.xml_)

Example:

``` ini
[Test]

dock_4="FileSystem"
dock_5="Inspector"
dock_7="Scene"
dock_hsplit_1=0
dock_hsplit_2=0
dock_hsplit_3=0
dock_hsplit_4=0
dock_split_2=0
dock_split_3=0
dock_split_4=0

[AnotherLayout]

dock_4="Inspector"
dock_1="FileSystem"
dock_7="Scene"
dock_hsplit_1=0
dock_hsplit_2=0
dock_hsplit_3=0
dock_hsplit_4=0
dock_split_2=0
dock_split_3=0
dock_split_4=0
```

The default layout is built-in, to avoid being deleted manually. Not sure if the best way.
Suggestions? :)

data.title: Load main scene if defined when running editor from the command line
data.body:
If no main scene is defined, or if it's an empty string, the previous behaviour will still be used, i.e. launch the project manager.
A small fix was also added not to maximize the window when opening the project manager via -editor (i.e. "godot" and "godot -e" will behave the same when no project is in the path).

Fixes #2869.

data.title: Better PropertyEditor search
data.body: Now the PropertyEditor search through subcategories and properties. If it find a category all the category parameters will be visible. But still searching and displaying individual properties.

data.title: "godot -e" in a project folder opens the project but not the main scene
data.body: Same with `godot -e -path /path/to/project`.

data.title: Fix can_move_to and rename it for more clarity
data.body:
Fixes #2416.
The KinematicBody::can_move_to function was likely designed for two behaviours:
- discrete: check if the body can "teleport" to the destination
- continuous: check if the direct path to the destination is valid

The continuous behaviour was however not implemented, and the discrete behaviour was broken too due to a wrong call to intersect_shape.

The discrete behaviour has thus been fixed and the function renamed to can_teleport_to for more clarity.

data.title: Script Editor Non-English Characters Problem
data.body: I'm using a Turkish keyboard and Turkish keymap. When I press the Turkish characters on my keyboard it doesn't shows Turkish characters on script editor but it cause syntax error, "unknown character". So everytime I press turkish characters by mistake or by forgetting GDScript doesn't support utf-8 I have to open script file with another text editor and delete the unknown(turkish) characters.

data.title: Tegra 3 fix
data.body: Fallback if 32 bits View is not available.

data.title: Fix PopupMenu returning wrong item index
data.body:
It's quite hard to explain the bug, but this is a sample code to recreate it:

``` GDScript
extends Button

var menu = PopupMenu.new()

func _ready():
    add_child(menu)
    connect("pressed", menu, "popup_centered")
    menu.add_item("First", 101) # index 0
    menu.add_item("Second", 102) # index 1
    menu.add_item("Third") # index 2
    menu.connect("item_pressed", self, "_menu_item_pressed")

func _menu_item_pressed(id): # or index if the item has no id
    if id > 100:
        print(menu.get_item_index(id))
    else:
        prints(id)
```

Output:

```
0 # First
1 # Second
0 # Third! Should be 2! How can two items have the same index!?
```

This PR fixes it. I still find it confusing to use (specially when procedurally adding items to the menu), since you don't know if the parameter passed is the id or the index... IMO the best would be to pass both with the _item_pressed_ signal.

data.title: Canvas editor selection menu shortcuts are pathological under *nix
data.body:
This issue is about #2786

Under Linux and BSDs, Alt+Right Click or Alt+Click don't even go to any app by default. These shortcuts respectively scale and move windows (handled by the window manager).

data.title: Implement name filter for PropertyEditor
data.body:
Added search bar on Inspector dock and on Project and Editor settings dialog.
- On Inspector dock and in Project Settings the search bar will show/hide when pressing the search button.
- On Editor settings dialog the search bar will be always visible.
- The Inspector dock will display all the object categories, i don't have found any good implementation for that.

![inspector_search](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8458222/11319490/a230c124-9057-11e5-893e-44e9c46131a1.png)

Closes #2768.
